text:
Hi guys :slightly_smiling_face:
Is there anyway to combine two HubDB tables on a page? I know there's the column join (stated above), but not sure it will work in my scenario
I've got a HubDB table based on Events, these have a Start Date and an End Date, eg. 2 Aug to 5 Aug
The other table is Webinars, which are one days events. The client doesn't want to see 2 Aug to 2 Aug on the frontend, so I've had to split the events into these two tables since leaving the date field blank automatically changes it to today's date.
Any ideas how to tackle this?
Can you run loops for each table, add the start date as an HTML data attribute then sort them with JS?
You could do logic where if the the start and end date are the same, dont show the end date. I did this for an events module I created
Ooo that's exactly what I'm after <@U2H3TT8F2>
Oh sorry I assumed you already had both tables filled
Having one table would be so much easier to maintain as essentially all the columns in both tables are the same, except the date column titles
basically if the dates are equal, it shows the date once, then I check the same check on the times so if the start and end times are the same, it wont show an endtime
Ace! Will play around with that, thanks :thumbsup:
